Core design of the app¶

classes and stuff that the app is built from

Core App¶

class h5xplorer.h5xplorer.QIPythonWidget(customBanner=None, colors='lightbg', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: qtconsole.rich_jupyter_widget.RichJupyterWidget

Convenience class for a live IPython console widget. Adapted from the pyQT example

Parameters:HDF5Object (HDF5 item) – Instance of a HDF5 item
get_value(variableDict)[source]¶

Get the dict of variables emmitted by the treeview. Note: if the name of variable starts with _ the value is NOT printed in the console.

Parameters:variableDict (dict) – dict of variables {name: value}

class h5xplorer.h5xplorer.HDF5TreeItem(data_file, parent, name, row)[source]¶

Bases: object

Create a new item for an HDF5 tree

Parameters:
  • data_file (HDF5 data file) – This is the file (NB must be the top-level group) containing everything
  • parent (HDF5TreeItem) – The parent of the current item
  • name (string) – The name of the current item (should be parent.name plus an extra component)
  • row (int) – The index of the current item in the parent’s children.

The underlying HDF5 item for this tree item.

Find the index of the parent of the item at a given index.

The data represented by this item.

Return the header names - an empty string here!

The number of rows exposed by the model

Whether or not this object has children

columnCount(index=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return the number of columns

refresh_tree()[source]¶

Reload the HDF5 tree, resetting the model This causes all cached HDF5 tree information to be deleted, and any views using this model will automatically reload.

selected_h5item_from_view(treeview)[source]¶

Given a treeview object, return the selection, as an HDF5 object, or a work-alike for multiple selection. If one item is selected, we will return the HDF5 group or dataset that is selected. If multiple items are selected, we will return a dummy HDF5 group containing all selected items.

set_up_treeview(treeview)[source]¶

Correctly configure a QTreeView to use this model. This will set the HDF5ItemModel as the tree’s model (data source), and in the future may set up context menus, etc. as appropriate.

class h5xplorer.h5xplorer.HDF5TreeWidget(datafile, res=None, menu=None, extended_selection=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QTreeView

Create a TreeView widget that views the contents of an HDF5 tree. :param datafile: nplab.datafile.Group :param the HDF5 tree to show:

Additional keyword arguments are passed to the QTreeView constructor. You may want to include parent, for example.

emitDict¶

A TreeView for looking at an HDF5 tree

selected_h5item()[source]¶

Return the current selection as an HDF5 item.

doubleClicked(event)[source]¶

Handle the double click on the different items If the item has no children its name/value are emitted and are pushed in the iPython console

Dialog box¶

class h5xplorer.standarddialogs.Dialog(varnames, window_name='Enter Values', parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Class to generate an user-defined input box

Example

>>> dialog = Dialog(varnames)
>>> dialog.exec_()
>>> return dialog.returnValues()
